N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4026.1 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Managing owner
means a person who through ownership, lease or designation manages all racing
activities for a race horse and is personally responsible for all liabilities
arising therefrom. (b) Nonmaging
owner means a person holding any property interest in a race horse and who is
not a managing owner. (c) Property
interest means any direct or indirect legal or beneficial interest in the
racing, breeding or other qualities of a race horse (including a right to share
in such horse's earnings or fees) whether present or future, established by
deed, lease, sale with contingencies, contract of sale, syndication agreement, right of possession, or otherwise. Both lessors and lessees hold a property
interest in a horse. Included in such term shall be any interest, direct or
indirect, in stock, shares, parts or otherwise of any legal entity holding a
property interest in a race horse (including administering or holding office in
such entity). Notes
